panels.description: Total usable space in bytes, not including WAFL reserve and aggregate Snapshot copy reserve.
panels.title: Total Space

panels.description:
Object Count.

Note: The REST and ZAPI collectors return a different number of volumes depending on whether you have set up object store servers on your cluster. 

For more details, visit the [ZAPI and REST Gaps](https://netapp.github.io/harvest/latest/zapi-and-rest-gap.md).
panels.title: Object Count

panels.description: Space used or reserved in bytes. Includes volume guarantees and aggregate metadata.
panels.title: Used and Reserved Space

panels.description: Total usable space in bytes, not including WAFL reserve and aggregate Snapshot copy reserve.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_space_total{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_space_total{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Total Space by Cluster

panels.description: Space used or reserved in bytes. Includes volume guarantees and aggregate metadata.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_space_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_space_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Used and Reserved Space by Cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_space_available{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_space_available{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

options.content:
These panels require ONTAP 9.6+ and the REST collector. Two actions are required to use this dashboard:
1. Enable the REST collector in your harvest.yml config
2. Enable the EMS collector in your harvest.yml config for EMS events
For more information on the issues, please check the `ONTAP: Health` dashboard.

targets.legendFormat: Lif are not at home port

panels.description: Average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process all the operations on the volume; not including request processing or network communication time.

targets.expr:
max by (cluster) (volume_avg_latency{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, max by (cluster) (avg_over_time(volume_avg_latency{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Latency by Cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (volume_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(volume_total_data{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.description: Number of operations per second serviced by the cluster.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (volume_total_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(volume_total_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources  IOPs by Cluster

targets.expr:
avg by (cluster) (node_cpu_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, avg by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_cpu_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.description: Average processor utilization across all processors in the system.

targets.expr:
avg by (cluster) (node_avg_processor_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, avg by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_avg_processor_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Average CPU Utilization by Cluster

options.content:
These panels require ONTAP 9.6+ and REST private CLI. See power algorithm for more details.
For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Power` dashboard.

panels.description: Maximum temperature of all non-ambient sensors for node in Celsius.
panels.title: Max Node Temp

panels.description: Maximum fan speed for shelf in rpm.
panels.title: Max Shelf Fan Speed

panels.description: Maximum temperature of all non-ambient sensors for shelf in Celsius.
panels.title: Max Shelf Temp

panels.description: Maximum fan speed for node in rpm.

options.content: For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

panels.description: Volumes Protected With Snapshot Copies (local). For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr: count(volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{})) OR on() vector(0)

count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy=~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{}))) OR on() vector(0)

panels.title: Protected Status

panels.description: Volumes Breaching Snapshot Copy Reserve Space.For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr: count(volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{}) * on (volume, svm, cluster) group_right() ( volume_snapshot_reserve_size{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 0 and volume_snapshots_size_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 0 and volume_snapshots_size_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} > volume_snapshot_reserve_size{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"})) OR on() vector(0)

(count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{})) * on (volume, svm, cluster) group_right() (volume_snapshot_reserve_size{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 0 and volume_snapshots_size_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 0 and volume_snapshots_size_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} <= volume_snapshot_reserve_size{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"})) OR on() vector(0)) + (count(volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{}) * on (volume, svm, cluster) group_right() ( volume_snapshot_reserve_size{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 0 and volume_snapshots_size_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter", cluster=~"$Cluster"} == 0)) OR on() vector(0))

panels.title: Breached Status

panels.description: For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr: count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})) * on (volume,svm,cluster) (volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} > 0 and volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} < 10)) OR on() vector(0)

count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})) * on (volume,svm,cluster) (volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} >= 10 and volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} <= 100)) OR on() vector(0)

count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})) * on (volume,svm,cluster) (volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} > 100 and volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} <= 500)) OR on() vector(0)

count((volume_labels{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster",snapshot_policy!="", snapshot_policy!~"none.*", volume!~"MDV.*"}  * on (snapshot_policy) group_left () group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_total_schedules{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})) * on (volume,svm,cluster) (volume_snapshot_count{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"} > 500)) OR on() vector(0)

panels.title: Snapshot Copies

panels.description: Storage efficiency ratio of total space used.
panels.title: Data Reduction with Snapshots &FlexClones

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_logical_used_wo_snapshots_flexclones{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_logical_used_wo_snapshots_flexclones{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

sum by (cluster) (aggr_physical_used_wo_snapshots_flexclones{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_physical_used_wo_snapshots_flexclones{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

sum by (cluster) (aggr_logical_used_wo_snapshots{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_logical_used_wo_snapshots{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Logical Used with FlexClones by Cluster

panels.description: Total Data Reduction Physical Used with FlexClones.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_physical_used_wo_snapshots{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_physical_used_wo_snapshots{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Physical Used with FlexClones by Cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_total_logical_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_total_logical_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Logical Used with Snapshots & FlexClones by Cluster

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (aggr_space_physical_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(aggr_space_physical_used{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Physical Used with Snapshots & FlexClones by Cluster

current.text: System CPU resource utilization is a computed percentage that indicates how busy the system is based on a combination of the most heavily utilized domain and idle CPU cycles. This metric determines the amount of available CPU and will vary based on domains reaching their limits OR exhausting all idle CPU cycles, whichever comes first.
current.value: System CPU resource utilization is a computed percentage that indicates how busy the system is based on a combination of the most heavily utilized domain and idle CPU cycles. This metric determines the amount of available CPU and will vary based on domains reaching their limits OR exhausting all idle CPU cycles, whichever comes first.
